title: Christophe Cordier 2014  Mâcon
description: This wine offers attractive citrus and yellow-fruit flavors. It is fresh, with a richer backdrop of perfumed fruit. The texture brings out the ripeness.

title: Domaine de la Denante 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé
description: This wine has soft fruit, a creamy texture and light acidity. It is balanced, fruity with apple and spice flavors. The aftertaste introduces a drier, woody character that is less attractive.

title: Domaine de la Mordorée 2014 La Remise Red (Vin de France)
description: This 50-50 blend of Marselan and Merlot opens with aromas of raspberry-cran-apple juice and underripe cherry. The light palate offers lithe tannins and a tart, fruit-skin astringency that lingers through the close.

title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo NV Plexus Tinto Sparkling (Tejo)
description: Made from Alicante Bouschet, this is a wine for drinkers who like experiences. With tannins, a dry texture balanced by black fruit, it will be a fine sparkler with food, and a conversation piece.

title: Salentein 2015 Portillo Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Valle de Uco)
description: Gritty, green aromas are not really ripe or friendly. This is high in pyrazines and tastes peppery and largely fruitless. A sour finish with sweaty notes are as expected given the nose and flavors.

title: Quinta da Calçada 2015 Lago Cerqueira Rosé (Vinho Verde)
description: Soft and candied, this is a ripe wine that has sweet strawberry-fruit flavors. It is ready to drink.

title: Domingo Hermanos 2014 Hermanos Malbec-Tannat (Salta)
description: This Salta blend of Malbec and Tannat smells a lot like fresh road tar. The palate is adequately cushioned, while hard, stalky, roasted berry flavors are oaky. This has a lot of disparate parts but the whole has issues and is sketchy.

title: Alba Roja 2012 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Harsh berry and plum aromas are damp and rubbery. This feels rubbery as well, with rough tannins. Stewy, nondescript berry flavors finish tannic and dry.

title: Valentin Bianchi 2015 Elsa Bianchi Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Stewy, jammy plum and currant aromas are less than inviting. This feels choppy, with hard tannins. Soupy, weedy berry flavors end with minty, herbal, grassy notes.

title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2015 Flamingo Escolha Rosé (Vinho Verde)
description: A light, sweet wine that has a faint prickle and candied-strawberry flavors. It is ready to drink.

title: Casanel 2014 Patricia Marie Pinot Gris (Middleburg)
description: Mild tones of cantaloupe, pear and apple mark this watery, light-bodied wine. It's simple and enjoyable, perfect for less serious situations.

title: Viniverde 2015 Estreia White (Vinho Verde)
description: This is a sweet, lightly sparkling wine. It has crisp apple as well as citrus flavors to contrast with the sweetness. Drink now.

title: Caves da Montanha 2014 Monte do Enforcado Branco White (Alentejano)
description: The wine is perfumed and so soft. It could make a good apéritif with its light texture and equally light acidity. Drink now.

title: Cadus 2014 Chardonnay (Valle de Uco)
description: Gritty, oily matchstick aromas are followed by a blocky palate with apricot, peach pit and citrus flavors. On the finish, a lasting flavor of citrus rind is tough and pithy. Overall this is hard to plow through.

title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2015  Bourgogne
description: The wine is so soft, with a fruit-candy flavor as well as lemon sherbet and some attractive touches of acidity. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Paul Bouchard & Cie NV Red (Vin de France)
description: This is a light and soft selection, with an upfront gamy note that's framed by soft strawberry, rhubarb, red cherry and currant fruit tones on the nose and mouth. Overall, it's short and direct; drink up.

title: Melrose 2012 Baco Noir (Umpqua Valley)
description: The color of bull's blood, this earthy, funky wine smells strongly of composted earth. It's rough, sharp and high-toned, with a volatile finish.

title: Robert Oatley 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Margaret River)
description: Overtly green in style, with asparagus notes that are too much for this reviewer. It does have some attractive crushed-stone aromas and an appealing mouthfeel, so it's not without charm.

title: Fat Monk 2013 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: A strong barnyard, even horse-stable character plays heavy on the nose of this bottling, with wild herbs, alfalfa and pomegranate fruit also detectable. Light cherries and cola arise on the sip, but the funkiness dominates there too.

title: Pedernales 2015 Viognier (Texas)
description: Charred caramel drizzled over pineapple rind show mildly on the nose. The palate is medium in weight, with a muddling of lemon and tart peach. This Viognier is crisp and to the point.

title: Salentein 2013 Single Vineyard San Pablo Estate Chardonnay (Valle de Uco)
description: One of the Uco Valley's highest vineyards has produced an awkward, funky, clunky Chardonnay with butterscotch, mustard and heavy oak aromas. Flavors of mustard and barrel resin follow the nose, while this finishes with pickled notes, a pinched mouthfeel and a sense of skins. Salentein needs to reassess this wine, which is new to its lineup.

title: Winery at La Grange 2014 Catherine's Vineyard Petit Manseng (Virginia)
description: While easy to grow in Virginia's vintage-variant climate, there still needs to be some work in the cellar for this Southwestern France transplant. The bottling is a variety of flavors and textures that don't quite seem to meld: honeycomb wax, citron and a slight char seem disjointed on the flabby palate.

title: Alba Roja 2012 Red (Mendoza)
description: Earthy at best, weedy at worst, this smells like savory red plum. Chunky and syrupy on the palate, with a shot of high-toned acidity, this tastes like briny, pickled raspberry and it rings with acidity on the finish.

title: Château de Beauregard 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé
description: There is a rustic edge to this flat wine. It is soft and lightly fruity although unfocused. Drink now.

title: Los Pinos Ranch 2015 Diamante Doble Vineyards Viognier (Texas High Plains)
description: Heady floral aromas of rose and lychee overtake the nose and palate. It's rich in weight, with very little acid to maintain balance.

title: Horton 2013 Private Reserve Roussanne (Virginia)
description: Fermented in a neutral barrel, this Roussanne brings praline and grilled peach into the mix. Weighty and flabby in feel, an overripe fruit character resounds on the palate.

title: Finca Flichman 2014 Paisaje de Tupungato Red (Mendoza)
description: Herbal, funky, rustic and green on the nose, this isn't terribly appealing up front. A clunky palate without much flow doesn't offer much help, while this blend tastes weedy and grassy.

title: Llano Estacado 2015 Mont Sec Vineyard Viognier (Texas)
description: Juicy Fruit gum and citrus blossom meet a chemical plastic note on the nose. The palate is light in weight, with sharp acids carrying along the peach juice and lemon flavors.

title: The Boneyard 2013 Skins Rkatsiteli (Monticello)
description: This Rkatsiteli was cold soaked for 11 days on the skins (hence the name) and then aged in barrels for 15 months. The result is something a bit odd and disjointed, with oak tones of toasted coconut and sunscreen clashing with soft quince and green apple streaks.

title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo NV Plexus Rosé Sparkling (Tejo)
description: This is a sweet, soapy wine that has some red fruit and acidity. It is soft, without much definition. Seriously chilled, it could be enjoyable.
